definition: "Erya" or "The Ready Guide", first extant Chinese dictionary, c. 3rd century BC, with glossaries on classical texts
thus/so/like that/you/thou
elegant
cultured and refined (idiom); gentle and cultivated
Ljubljana, capital of Slovenia

sentences.english: So who is the debonair looking guy in the photograph above?
sentences.chinese: 誰是我們在上面照片中看到的那個溫文爾雅的人呢？

sentences.english: She is a cultured and bright girl.
sentences.chinese: 她是一個溫文爾雅，聰明伶俐的女孩。

sentences.english: For the first time her veneer of politeness began to crack.
sentences.chinese: 她溫文爾雅的外表第一次露出破綻。

sentences.english: Her only asset was a gentle nature.
sentences.chinese: 她唯一的可貴之處是溫文爾雅的性情。

sentences.english: The little girl isgentleandcultivatedand everybody likes her.
sentences.chinese: 這小姑娘溫文爾雅，大家都很喜歡她。

sentences.english: Mallya's assets, including his estate in Goa.
sentences.chinese: 銀行試圖凍結馬爾雅的資產，包括他在果阿邦的地產。

sentences.english: Then, last of all, I desiderate urbanity.
sentences.chinese: 最後，我渴望練就溫文爾雅的性情。

sentences.english: The synonyms in ERYA mostly distribute in the last sixteen pieces.
sentences.chinese: 《爾雅》的同實異名主要分佈於後十六篇。

sentences.english: I like it like the small white rabbit, gentle, naughty lovely personality.
sentences.chinese: 我喜歡小白兔，喜歡它溫文爾雅，淘氣可愛的性格。

sentences.english: On can always be kind to people one cares nothing about.
sentences.chinese: 對於哪些偶們漠不關心地人，偶們總能做到溫文爾雅。

sentences.english: Despite his goatee, Mr Mallya deserves a hearing.
sentences.chinese: 不管他的山羊鬍子，馬爾雅先生需要一場聽證會。

sentences.english: She took a glasses, talk in class to stomach.
sentences.chinese: 她帶着一個眼鏡，講起課來溫文爾雅。

sentences.english: This has established the book of Erya as an important works in the world history of science.
sentences.chinese: 這奠定了《爾雅》一書是世界科學史上的重要著作。

sentences.english: My new teacher is a very gentle person.
sentences.chinese: 我的新老師是一個溫文爾雅的人。

sentences.english: Mr. Mallya quickly added a lavish business class to Kingfisher.
sentences.chinese: 馬爾雅很快給翠鳥航空增加了一款奢華的商務艙。

sentences.english: He was a bear of a man, but kind and gentle.
sentences.chinese: 他是個長得粗獷的男人，但舉止溫文爾雅。

definition: Classic of Rites
Zheng Xuan (127-200), late Han scholar
earliest extant Chinese encyclopedia from Wei of the Three Kingdoms, 3rd century, modeled on Erya 爾雅|尔雅[Er3 ya3], 18150 entries
History of the Former Han Dynasty, second of the 24 dynastic histories 二十四史[Er4 shi2 si4 Shi3], composed by Ban Gu 班固[Ban1 Gu4] in 82 during Eastern Han (later Han), 100 scrolls
the Rites of Zhou (in Confucianism)
Rites and Ceremonies, part of the Confucian Classic of Rites 禮記|礼记[Li3 ji4]
Shuowen Jiezi, the original Han dynasty Chinese character dictionary with 10,516 entries, authored by Xu Shen 許慎|许慎[Xu3 Shen4] in 2nd century
sound and meaning
Kong Yingda (574-648), Confucian scholar
Xiaojing (Classic of Filial Piety)
that being the case/then/in that case
Mr Gongyang's Annals or commentary on 春秋[Chun1 qiu1], early history, probably written by multiple authors during Han dynasty, same as 公羊春秋[Gong1 yang2 Chun1 qiu1]
see 說文解字|说文解字[Shuo1 wen2 Jie3 zi4]

lit. “Mr. Lü's Spring and Autumn (Annals)”, compendium of the philosophies of the Hundred Schools of Thought 諸子百家|诸子百家[zhu1 zi3 bai3 jia1], compiled around 239 BC under the patronage of Qin Dynasty 秦代[Qin2 dai4] Chancellor Lü Buwei 呂不韋|吕不韦[Lu:3 Bu4 wei2]
interpreting words/to explain the meaning of words in classic texts/to decipher an old script
to be well-mannered
